title: Taj Mahal
address: Dharmapuri, Forest Colony, Tajganj, Agra, Uttar Pradesh 282001
desc: A symbol of love, the Taj Mahal is a magnificent white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal.
history: The Taj Mahal was commissioned in 1632 by Shah Jahan and completed in 1653. It is considered one of the most beautiful buildings in the world and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
geography: Located on the right bank of the Yamuna River in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India.
additionalDetails: The Taj Mahal is known for its intricate carvings and lush gardens surrounding the structure.

title: Qutub Minar
desc: Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the tallest brick minarets in the world, built in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak.
history: Construction of the Qutub Minar was started in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak and completed by his successor Iltutmish. It showcases the architectural brilliance of the Mamluk dynasty.
geography: Located in the Mehrauli area of New Delhi, India.
additionalDetails: The Qutub Minar complex includes other historical monuments such as the Iron Pillar and the Alai Darwaza.

title: Hampi
desc: Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its ancient temples, ruins of palaces, and the historic Virupaksha Temple.
history: Hampi was the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire in the 14th century and was known for its prosperity and magnificent architecture.
geography: Situated in the Ballari district of Karnataka, India, near the Tungabhadra River.
additionalDetails: The site is known for its unique rocky landscape and ancient ruins.

title: Ajanta Caves
desc: The Ajanta Caves are rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments dating from the 2nd century BCE to about 480 CE, famous for their beautiful frescoes and sculptures.
history: The Ajanta Caves were built in two phases: the first during the 2nd century BCE and the second during the 5th century CE. They were rediscovered in 1819 by a British officer.
geography: Located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra, India, near the Waghora River.
additionalDetails: The caves are renowned for their detailed frescoes and sculptures depicting the life of Buddha.

title: Khajuraho Temples
desc: The Khajuraho Group of Monuments is a group of Hindu and Jain temples in Madhya Pradesh, known for their intricate and erotic sculptures.
history: Built between 950 and 1050 by the Chandela dynasty, these temples are known for their nagara-style architecture and erotic sculptures.
geography: Located in the Chhatarpur district of Madhya Pradesh, India.
additionalDetails: The temples are categorized into three groups: Western, Eastern, and Southern, each showcasing different aspects of Hindu and Jain traditions.

title: Konark Sun Temple
desc: The Konark Sun Temple is a 13th-century CE sun temple at Konark, Odisha, built by King Narasimhadeva I and famous for its monumental representation of the Sun God's chariot.
history: Built in the 13th century by King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga dynasty, the temple is designed as a colossal chariot of the Sun God, Surya.
geography: Located on the eastern coast of India in the Puri district of Odisha.
additionalDetails: The temple is renowned for its intricate stone carvings and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: Red Fort
address: Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006
desc: The Red Fort is a historic fort in Delhi that served as the main residence of the Mughal Emperors for nearly 200 years.
history: Constructed by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1638, the fort served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors until 1857.
geography: Located in the heart of Delhi, India.
additionalDetails: The fort is known for its massive red sandstone walls and houses several museums.

title: Meenakshi Temple
desc: The Meenakshi Temple is a historic Hindu temple located on the southern bank of the Vaigai River in the temple city of Madurai, Tamil Nadu.
history: The Meenakshi Temple dates back to the 6th century CE and was expanded during the Nayak dynasty in the 16th century.
geography: Located in the temple city of Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India.
additionalDetails: The temple is renowned for its towering gopurams (gateway towers) and intricate carvings.

title: Mysore Palace
address: Sayyaji Rao Rd, Agrahara, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001
desc: Mysore Palace, also known as the Amba Vilas Palace, is a historical palace and a royal residence at Mysore in the southern Karnataka state.
history: The palace was originally built in the 14th century but underwent reconstruction in the 19th century by the Wodeyar dynasty.
geography: Located in the city of Mysore, Karnataka, India.
additionalDetails: The palace is known for its Indo-Saracenic architecture and the grand illumination during the Dasara festival.

title: Victoria Memorial
desc: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building in Kolkata, built between 1906 and 1921 to commemorate Queen Victoria's 25-year reign in India.
history: The memorial was built to commemorate the 25-year reign of Queen Victoria and was completed in 1921. It was designed by architect William Emerson.
geography: Located in the city of Kolkata, West Bengal, India, near the eastern bank of the Hooghly River.
additionalDetails: The Victoria Memorial is surrounded by lush gardens and houses a museum with a large collection of British-era artifacts.
